Regina Lai
Computer Science Graduate of 2019

About

Hello! My name is Regina and I have a Bachelor's degree in Biochemistry and recently completed a second degree in Computer Science at the University of British Columbia. People love asking me why did I make such a big career change. During my Biochemistry degree, I had the opportunity to work in a Bioinformatics lab and that was what sparked my interest to learn more about Computer Science.

Did I dislike Biochemistry? No! My undergraduate work was even part of a paper published in a scientific journal (link here if you're interested).

I like that in computer science, I can still have my problem solving urges met but in a much shorter time frame.

I've had the opportunity to work as a co-op at 2 different startup companies where I've gained the ability to learn new skills quickly. I had a lot of fun as a developer and do not regret my career change.

My passions outside of coding include drawing, baking, and playing video games.

Developed a 2D scrolling platformer in a group of 6 in C++. Voted best game out of 12 by industry professionals that acted as external judges.

  • Technologies: C++, OpenGL
  • Date: Jan - Apr 2019
  • Source: github.com/ReggieLai/minos-monster-maze

  • Improved stability of the web-application platform in delivering text messages to patients using Node.js
  • Developed a new feature allowing patients to choose different messaging frequencies for receiving checkups both in the backend and frontend using Node.js and Angular
  • Created data migration scrips to update old data base structures to the newest data base structure

  • Technologies: Node.js, Angular, MySQL
  • Date: May - Aug 2018
  • Source: www.weltel.org

  • Developed a process to automate the creation of a component that required parsing of a RSS feed and the use of Java, Maven, and the GWT web toolkit
  • Established good technical communication skills through the participation of daily scrums and technical documentation
  • Fixed bugs posted on JIRA using Java and CSS

  • Technologies: Java, Maven, GWT, Jenkins
  • Date: Sep - Dec 2017
  • Source: www.jostle.me

Developed a single-player PC game from scratch using C# in Unity and employing the observer design pattern
